issue.title: [CF 573] Prioritize high duration not working
issue.body:
^1^T^SShowTimer^B ^SSort^N1 ^SType^Sbuff ^SName^SSpell~`Reflection;~`Mass~`Spell~`Reflection ^SSettingsPerView^T ^Sexp^T ^STextLayout^S ^t^Sicon^T ^STextLayout^Sicon1 ^t^Sbar^T ^STextLayout^Sbar1 ^t^t^SEnabled^B ^SEvents^T ^SOnShow^T ^SDuration^N5 ^SPeriod^N0.1 ^t^t^SShowTimerText^B ^t^N60303^S~`~| ^Sicon^^

This is the icon that made me notice the issue. Prioritizing high duration seems to do just the same as normal prioritization. Oh, and the auras are also coming with a number indicating remaining charges (always 1), which is kind of reduntant for these.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #573 | Raw

comments.body:
I decided at the last minute to change [Stacks:Hide('0', '1')] to [Stacks:Hide('0')], because Blizzard is technically supposed to report spells that cant stack as having nil stacks instead of 1 when present. That's why you are getting the 1 on the stack text. You can always set it to hide both 0 and 1 for this specific case.

As for sort not working... activate programmer-who-seems-to-periodically-forget-how-half-his-code-works-while-working-on-it mode. Fixed in r whatever the next revision is.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
